intro: Bletia lankesteri, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a terrestrial orchid with a pseudobulb and linear leaves that form a rosette. The plant produces pendulous inflorescences with showy, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Bletia lankesteri thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and relatively easy care requirements.
